author: Vincent Hoong J:
casenumber: General Division of the High Court — Magistrate’s Appeal No 9689 of 2020/01; Magistrate’s Appeal No 9689 of 2020/02
casename: Public Prosecutor v Song Hauming Oskar and another appeal
counsel: Mohamed Faizal SC and Niranjan Ranjakunalan (Attorney-General’s Chambers) for the appellant in MA 9689/2020/01 and respondent in MA 9689/2020/02; Harbajan Singh s/o Karpal Singh (Daisy Yeo & Co.) for the respondent in MA 9689/2020/01 and appellant in MA 9689/2020/02; Victor Leong (Audent Chambers LLC) as amicus curiae.

headings.text: Issue 1: are community sentences statutorily available in light of the Amalgamated Cheating Charge?
Plain meaning of the relevant CPC provisions
Does “offence” under s 337(1)(i) CPC encompass an amalgamated offence?
Other contextual clues relevant to the meaning of “offence” in s 337(1)(i) CPC
Legislative purpose of ss 337(1)(i), 124(4) and 124(8)(a)(ii) CPC
Choosing an interpretation that promotes the purpose of the underlying written law
Addressing the remaining concerns highlighted by the DJ
Issue 2: what is the appropriate sentence?
What is the dominant sentencing consideration?
(1) Further downward adjustment on account of offender-specific factors?
